title: How to Give Someone a Facial

steps.title: The first 2 most important steps in a facial, is to:
steps.content: The first 2 most important steps in a facial, is to: Disinfect your hands. [1] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Gather some info from your client about themselves. E.g: Do they have any allergies or sensitivities to any certain ingredients, which are often used in cosmetics or applied directly to the skin during aesthetic treatments. This is very important to know, as if these are applied, they will definitely produce the opposite results in which you are trying to achieve with your facial application.

steps.title: Have your client lie down on a clean bed with clean sheets and pillow.
steps.content: Have your client lie down on a clean bed with clean sheets and pillow. Wrap a clean towel around your client's head.

steps.title: If your client happens to be wearing any makeup when they come in for their facial, then you must cleanse away the makeup.
steps.content: If your client happens to be wearing any makeup when they come in for their facial, then you must cleanse away the makeup. If she happens to be wearing eye makeup, apply eye makeup remover to a cotton pad, to gently cleanse the eye area. Always cleanse the eye area in counter clock wise to avoid wrinkling the eye area. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Apply two moistened cotton pads to your client's eyes, while you are taking a close look at their skin.
steps.content: Apply two moistened cotton pads to your client's eyes, while you are taking a close look at their skin. Have a lamp right over your client's face, hence the need for the cotton pads on the eyes, and take notice of any flaws or blemishes, for example: comedones, pimples, etc size of pores, fine lines, dehydration, etc. These will determine the type of skin your client has. [3] X Research source There are four main skin types: Normal: This is considered the best skin type. It is has a good oil/water balance, with no impurities, or fine lines. Dry: This skin type has very tight pores, due to lack of oil. While it will not have any impurities, it tends to mature faster, and develop fine lines faster. Combination: Parts of the face are oily, while other parts are dry(usually the T Zone((the forehead, nose, and chin area))is the oily part, while the cheeks are the dry part). Oily: this skin type, has an overabundance of oil. Although this skin type matures the slowest, it usually has a shiny surface and multiple impurities.

steps.title: Once you have a pretty good idea as to your client's skin type, you may be able to continue your regime.
steps.content: Once you have a pretty good idea as to your client's skin type, you may be able to continue your regime.

steps.title: Apply an exfoliating cleanser in circular motions.
steps.content: Apply an exfoliating cleanser in circular motions. Exfoliating is good for the skin as it sloughs away dead cells from the skin which accumulate, and prevents newer cells from growing. [4] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Once this is done, you may pat the skin dry.

steps.title: Massage your client's face:
steps.content: Massage your client's face: Take some massage cream or oil, and apply it freely to your client's skin. [5] X Research source Once this is done, you may start doing upward strokes on the skin. Don't use downward strokes on the skin, as gravity will pull the skin down, apparently. Do a little "tap dance" with your finger tips on your client's skin; use your index finger and your middle finger in a "scissors" like motion along the jaw line. Massaging the skin will increase the blood flow in your client's face.

steps.title: Steam the pores on your client's face:
steps.content: Steam the pores on your client's face: The best way to steam pores from scratch, salons and spas usually have steamers for their aestheticians to use on their clients, is to take a warm towel and wrap it around your client's face for about two minutes. This will open the pores on the face. It is best to have open pores when applying a beauty mask. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Take a paint brush or a spatula and apply a mineral-rich mud or clay, and smooth it all over your client's face.
steps.content: Take a paint brush or a spatula and apply a mineral-rich mud or clay, and smooth it all over your client's face. Mud masks clean out the pores and strengthen them. Leave only the eye area, you may want to put some more cotton pads onto the eyes to avoid getting the mud into eye area. The type of face mask you use is up to your clientâ€™s skin type. For instance, if they have dry skin, opt for a moisturizing mask.

steps.title: Leave beauty mask on for approximately 20 min.
steps.content: Leave beauty mask on for approximately 20 min. Then gently wash off. [7] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source

steps.title: Apply skin toner or astringent once mud mask is washed off.
steps.content: Apply skin toner or astringent once mud mask is washed off. This will close pores, as well as remove excess oil and impurities, which were not washed away with cleanser. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Apply moisturizer to skin.
steps.content: Apply moisturizer to skin. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Give a light spray of water to the skin(to hydrate skin).
steps.content: Give a light spray of water to the skin(to hydrate skin).

steps.title: Facial is complete.
steps.content: Facial is complete. Give your client a mirror to view him/herself, and humbly accept their happy cries as they see how beautiful they are.
